content.webTitle: Football: Mass brawl forces Essex Cup tie to be abandoned

fields.headline: Mass brawl forces Essex Cup tie to be abandoned
fields.bodyText: The FA faces what could be an unprecedented disciplinary decision when it considers Monday night's abandonment of the Chelmsford City v Braintree Essex Senior Cup semi-final after some 30 players and officials became involved in a mass touchline brawl lasting more than three minutes. The referee Keith Yeo, who had not issued a single yellow card, called a halt after a five-minute consultation with his assistants. The FA statistician David Barber said: "In my experience this is extremely rare. If it does happen, it's more likely to be at Sunday league level. I've been to 5,056 matches, at all levels, and I've never seen it."
